selected_quotes: West Africans are ditching African prints/Kitenge/Ankara/Dutch wax prints for Chinese real-fakes (embr…
Consumers are more interested in the quality and look of the cloth, and the way it reflects their taste and status.
The majority of Dutch designs available on African markets are low-cost reproductions made in China.
Togolese fabric markets are increasingly stocked with low-cost Chinese reproductions.
Is IP relevant in African markets for Chinese-made Dutch wax prints based on Javanese batik?

citation.abstract: Togolese consumers are increasingly choosing Chinese replicas over 'authentic' Dutch wax prints. Their choice raises fundamental questions about the notion of intellectual property.
citation.title: West Africans ditch Dutch wax prints for Chinese 'real-fakes'
